rounds.comments: (Alex: Reference to the newspaper, of course.)

clues.text: The Post calls this entertainer "Wacko Jacko", as in "Wacko Jacko Backo"
In 1977 the Post sold 1 million papers instead of the usual 600,000 when this NYC serial killer was "Caught!"
Reporting a scandal, the Post put "Dis-" before this name of the NYC mayor's residence
The Post smelled the blood of this tabloid rival with August 7, 1992's "Save-the-News Talks in Chaos"
The Post created this alliterative appellation for escort service boss Sydney Biddle Barrows
He romances 17-year-old Mariel Hemingway in his 1979 movie "Manhattan"
In 1949's "White Heat" he reaches the "top of the world" before blowing up
In "Pride of the Yankees", Gary Cooper played this proud but ailing Yankee
Peter Graves spies on William Holden & the other G.I.s in this 1953 P.O.W. film

Oscar-winning political drama seen here
(with Broderick Crawford speaking)
He played the Devil in the 1984 film "Oh, God! You Devil" (by the way, he also played God)
(Alex: And to help set up the clue, please welcome Broadway's "Phantom of the Opera", Howard McGillen)  Act I of "Phantom of the Opera" ends with this fixture crashing to the stage
In 1974 he tied Babe Ruth's record in his first at-bat of the season
Employees say "Thank God it's" this, especially when a dress code makes it "casual"
The albums "So" & "Us" made a megastar of this first lead singer of Genesis
This novel was originally published in 1844 as "Les Trois Mousquetaires"
In titles of Edgar Rice Burroughs novels, this name precedes "Lord of the Jungle" & "of the Apes"
Jim Hawkins spies on Long John Silver from an apple barrel in this Robert Louis Stevenson novel
This Southern novel about defense lawyer Atticus Finch is narrated by his daughter
A man travels over 800,000 years in this title device only to have it stolen by Morlocks
A synonym for blackjack, or a "numerical" restaurant on West 52nd Street
Whether you prefer beluga or sevruga, it's the specialty of Petrossian on West 58th Street
Possibly the most romantic restaurant in Brooklyn, the River Cafe overlooks this river
This railroad terminal on 42nd Street is home to a world-famous oyster bar
Perhaps your caricature is on the wall in this Theatre District landmark at 234 West 44th St.
This Cardinal slugger hit his 500th career homer in 1999
Nicknamed "The Rocket", this pitcher won 3 Cy Young Awards with the Red Sox & 2 with the Blue Jays
Flags at Dodger Stadium flew at half-staff after this '50s all-star died Aug. 14, 1999
One of the 2 all-stars who reached the 3,000-hit mark in 1999
This Minnesota Twin inspired the Kirby Bear, a stuffed doll wearing his No. 34 jersey
The Miss America pageant was begun to extend the Atlantic City tourist season past this holiday
It's Keep America Beautiful month, & the month in which you'd find Earth Day
On February 25 this Asian nation celebrates the fall of Ferdinand Marcos in 1986
It's St. Clement Hofbauer's feast day; it wasn't a good one for Julius Caesar
Hey, it's October 23, Chulalongkorn Day, in this southeast Asian country; shall we dance?
About 65 percent of you & about 85 percent of an apple consist of this
It's what John Smith could have called his dad's mom, or a variety of green apple grown in the U.S.
Hawkeye Pierce of "M*A*S*H" hailed from a Maine "cove" that shared its name with this type of small wild apple
Products from apples include jelly, vinegar & this apple brandy that partly bears a man's name
At 976,300,000 bushels, this Asian country led the world in apple production in 1998; the U.S. was 2nd at 271,100,000
In the 1980s the Strategic Defense Initiative was given this nickname
It's a term for the right-hand side of a ship, facing forward
If this 5-armed creature loses a limb, it can regenerate a new one
Ed McMahon hosted this show on which aspiring performers competed in categories like TV Spokesmodel
Slang for an astronomer, it can also mean a daydreamer
Jake & Elwood are on a mission from God in this film
2 friends are on a mission with their Illinois public access show in this film
2 aliens from the planet Remulak are on a mission to raise their teen daughter in this film
Will Ferrell & Chris Kattan are on a mission to get into the best club in town & open their own in this film
Julia Sweeney is on a mission to have a relationship with Chris, a person of indeterminate sex in this film

"Ask any mermaid
you happen to see,
"What's the best tuna?'..."
This cereal is "A honey of an O"
It "rinses cleaner than soap"
"You'll wonder where the yellow went when you brush your teeth with" this
This brand "has the lock on freshness"
Smile! A photograph was taken of you with one of these photon streams that's also known as a Roentgen ray
You might be needled by this 4,000-year-old technique in widespread use in Chinese hospitals
Intensive care is also called this "care", like the condition patients may be in

It's this person's job to knock you out in the O.R.
(without using a hammer)
A neonatal ICU may contain several isolettes, a type of this chamber, from the Latin for "to lie down"

rounds.text: 2 of the 4 Best Picture winners with nationalities in the title
rounds.response: (2 of) The English Patient, An American in Paris, The French Connection & American Beauty
